required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: How Astigmatism Influences Corneal Biomechanics and Intraocular Pressure
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Preoperative Astigmatism on Corneal Biomechanics and Accurate Intraocular Pressure Measurement After Micro-incision Phacoemulsification

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to identify whether preoperative corneal astigmatism can influence corneal biomechanics and the assessment of intraocular pressure (IOP) following micro-incision phacoemulsification.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Parameter measured preoperatively and one day, one week, one month postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure and corneal biomechanical properties were measured using an Ocular Response Analyzer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Parameter measured preoperatively and one day, one week, one month postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure and corneal biomechanical properties were measured using an Ocular Response Analyzer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Parameter measured preoperatively and one day, one week, one month postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure and corneal biomechanical properties were measured using an Ocular Response Analyzer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Parameter measured preoperatively and one day, one week, one month postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure and corneal biomechanical properties were measured using an Ocular Response Analyzer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Parameter measured preoperatively and one day, one week, one month postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure and corneal biomechanical properties were measured using an Ocular Response Analyzer.

intervention.description: Non-contact measurement of corneal biomechanical properties and intraocular pressure with an Ocular Response Analyzer. Parameters measured: corneal hysteresis (CH), corneal resistance factor (CRF), Goldman-correlated IOP (IOPg), corneal compensated IOP (IOPcc) and waveform score (WS).

study_pop.textblock: 39 patients diagnosed with cataracts were enrolled in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis and qualification for cataract surgery, corneal astigmatism of equal to or less than 2.25 Dcyl
Exclusion Criteria:
- corneal astigmatism higher than 2.25 Dcyl, history of any other corneal disease (infection, trauma, ulceration, autoimmune inflammation, Fuchs Dystrophy, keratoconus, corneal scars, preoperative insufficiency of corneal endothelium), glaucoma and chronic use of non-glaucoma eye drops, blepharitis, dry eye, use of contact lenses diabetes or a history of corneal refractive surgery
